Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Bump to mono/mono/2019-02@e113ce92" (#3153) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Merged pull request "[docs] Move images for messages docs alongside the docs" (#3151) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/pull/3087

As an additional step toward preparing the message docs to be synced to
docs.microsoft.com, place the images for the docs within their own
`images` subdirectory alongside the Markdown files.  That way, the
automation to synchronize the pages won't need to look through the
Markdown files to find linked images.  It can instead just copy the
whole `images` subdirectory to the same relative location in the
non-public xamarin-engineering-docs-pr mirror.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[docs] Remove links for message codes that don't yet have pages" (#3154) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/pull/3087

As an additional step toward preparing the message docs to be synced to
docs.microsoft.com, remove the two dead links in the README page for the
message codes.  These links can be added back if dedicated pages are
written for these message codes in the future.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[build] Override default yaml checkout behavior" (#3157) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
We're hitting a couple of git related issues on certain machines, most
commonly around submodule updating on Windows. Rather than relying on an
msbuild setup task to do this, we should override the default pipeline
source checkout behavior. We'll now fetch a clean tree and recursively
clone all relevant submodules for each build stage.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[mono-runtimes] include Mono.CompilerServices.SymbolWriter" (#3158) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/commit/055dabe34e1897305be178a260faee3815e3e908
Context: http://build.devdiv.io/2725037

Windows builds seem to be failing with:

    "tests\Runtime-MultiDex\Mono.Android-TestsMultiDex.csproj" (default target) (38) ->
    (_ConvertPdbFiles target) ->
      Xamarin.Android.Common.targets(2060,2): warning : Could not load file or assembly 'Mono.CompilerServices.SymbolWriter, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=0738eb9f132ed756' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified. [E:\A\_work\2218\s\tests\Runtime-MultiDex\Mono.Android-TestsMultiDex.csproj]
      Xamarin.Android.Common.targets(2060,2): warning :    at Pdb2Mdb.Converter.Convert(String filename) [E:\A\_work\2218\s\tests\Runtime-MultiDex\Mono.Android-TestsMultiDex.csproj]

I see this file in the mono archive, so it looks like we missed this
assembly in 055dabe.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[build] Override default yaml checkout behavior" (#3157) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
We're hitting a couple of git related issues on certain machines, most
commonly around submodule updating on Windows. Rather than relying on an
msbuild setup task to do this, we should override the default pipeline
source checkout behavior. We'll now fetch a clean tree and recursively
clone all relevant submodules for each build stage.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feedback] Xamarin Forms Shared project UWP menu disappears with no way to go back or show the menu again." (#5637) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

I implemented MasterDetailPage into my app, but on Windows 10 the behavior seems a bit weird. When the app starts, the menu is showing as expected. But when I click an item, it disappears with no way to go back or show the menu again.

This has been reported before some 19months ago and isn’t something new.

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45640159/xamarin-masterdetailpage-menu-on-uwp

Easy to reproduce with a MasterDetailPage set MasterBehavior = MasterBehavior.Popover

  1. Detail = …some new page;
    IsPresented = false;

  2. . …menu is now gone forever in UWP?

View on Developer Community
To find diagnostic information, see the original linked feedback ticket. ### Source [823510](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/823510)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Xamarin.Forms UWP Navigation bar Disappear while press back button to MasterDetailPage " (#5412) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
MasterDetailPage is the root page.
Press button from master page's button ,Navigate to Setting Page is done.
Press the back button on the top of the window , Navigate to Mainpage(MasterDetailPage).
Navigation bar Disappear
(I had been set `<NavigationPage.HasNavigationBar>true</NavigationPage.HasNavigationBar>` in detail page)

Sample code here:
[TopBarSample.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2914278/TopBarSample.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[CollectionView,Frame] Margin on Frame is not respected in CollectionView" (#5782) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
The Margin on Frame is not respected in CollectionView. This is when the Frame is the MainLayout of DataTemplate. If the Fame is put inside StackLayout the Margins are respected.

### Steps to Reproduce
Remove parent StackLayout from Frame in CollectionView DataTemplate from the repro project. 

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms-pre7
- IDE:Visual Studio for Mac 2019 preview

- Affected Devices:iOS and Android

### Reproduction Link

[MyApp.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/3033578/MyApp.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Frame, CollectionView, Android]The Label.Text is invisible on Android if DataTemplate have frame as layout" (#5765) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
I have developed a xaml page for an app. It have CollectionView. When I have Frame as Layout in DataTemplate of CollectionView The Label.Text field on Android is invisible. Whereas when I put the Frame in StackLayout the Text becomes visible.
### Steps to Reproduce
Remove the parent StackLayout  from child FrameLayout in CollectionView DataTemplate using my sample.


### Basic Information

- Version with issue:Xamarin.Forms- pre7
- IDE:VSMac 2019 preview

- Affected Devices: Android


### Reproduction Link

[MyApp.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/3025610/MyApp.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "No longer able to compile after upgrading to XF 4.0.0 Service Release 1" (#6375) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
After upgrading to XF 4.0.0 SR1 I can no longer compile my solution.

Error |   | Position 5:14. Missing a public static GetAutowireViewModel or a public instance property getter for the attached property "Prism.Mvvm.ViewModelLocator.AutowireViewModelProperty" | TestCase | C:\Users\Administrator\Documents\Code\TestCase\TestCase\TestCase\Views\TestPage.xaml   


<!-- REQUIRED -->
<!-- Issues reporting a bug, but lacking a Reproduction will be closed!
     Please ask questions on StackOverflow or on Slack. Issues opened
     that are questions will be closed without comment.  -->

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Using VS2019 create a new XF app.
2. Update XF to latest service release.
3. Add Prism.DryIoc.Forms to projects.
4. Add a new Prism ContentPage using the template pack.
5. Compile the solution.

### Expected Behavior
Clean compile

### Actual Behavior
Compile failure

Error |   | Position 5:14. Missing a public static GetAutowireViewModel or a public instance property getter for the attached property "Prism.Mvvm.ViewModelLocator.AutowireViewModelProperty" | TestCase | C:\Users\Administrator\Documents\Code\TestCase\TestCase\TestCase\Views\TestPage.xaml  

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: XF 4.0.0.471375 Prism.DryIoc.Forms 7.1.0.431
- Last known good version: XF 4.0.0.425677 Prism.DryIoc.Forms 7.1.0.431
- IDE: VS2019

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Issue using template with ShellContent" (#6037) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
I have a Shell with several ShellSections.
One has 3 ShellContents each with the same Page but with different flags passed in on create to provide different selections ("All", "Selected" and "Unselected").

If I add a new item using a separate page, I want to refresh the 3 ShellContent pages on returning from the NewItem page.

Since changing to use a ContentTemplate for performance reasons there is no ShellContent.Content so no way to pass a message to the pages.

I cannot set a global flag to say "refresh" as there appears to be no event which will always fire on returning from the NewItem page (Appearing only seems to fire once).
I cannot use the Navigated event in the shell as there appears to be no way to access the ShellContent.Content from there.

This needs a solution as I can see this being a common issue.

I am on the latest Xamarin Forms 4 preview as of 28/4/2019

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Console.WriteLine does not clear its buffer immediately so messages may be duplicate if called very quickly in succession from different threads." (#6197) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
If two event handlers are fired from different threads, and each write to the console with Console.WriteLine, if those writes are too quick in succession, one or the other or both messages may appear twice. 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open the attached test project and run to an iOS device or simulator
2. Click the "Fire Event Handlers" button and observe the console output. 

### Expected Behavior
the text 
"***** TestEvent: Should show once" 
and 
"********** TestEvent2: Should should show once"
should show once each in the console output.

### Actual Behavior
One or the other or both of those messages may be duplicated. 

### Notes
There is also a spacer button in the UI to put a spacer in the console output to make it easier to see successive runs of the event handlers separated in the console output. So if you want to test multiple taps of the "Fire Event Handlers" button, hit the "Add spacer to console output" button between taps of the  "Fire Event Handlers" button.

This issue does not occur in pure Mono console app. 

### Environment
